I enjoyed the game due to its immersive experience and complex story.

Best game I've ever played hands down. Control are a little bit funny which means that some fights get quite difficult. But the story line is absolutely incredible. I got just under 12 hours of gameplay and I looked around every nook and cranny in each scene, which is exactly what you should do as well.

BUY IT

Bioshock infinite is a definite masterpiece, its the type of game that makes you think : [i]is game an art?[/i]
First of all the story is simply mindblowing, same type of mindblowing you'd see after watching a Nolan's film, not only that it's also rich in emotions, the relationship between Booker and Elizabeth is just so deep and moving you can feel their bond. During your playthrough you're guaranteed to have a roller coaster of emotions, whether it be adrenaline, tension, sadness, joy, you have it all.
The characters are so realistic you feel for them and it makes you want to fight for them even more.
You must think, then this is more of a movie than a game right? You couldn't be more wrong, almost all the gameplay mechanics from the first Bioshock are here! The only downside of infinite in my opinion is how short it is.

Bioshock infinite is a true work of art ğŸ¨

I'm not usually into FPS games like CS:GO or anything like it. But it's a different thing when it comes to the story. Especially BioShock Infinite.

A lot of FPS games are just realistic and look-alike, like... what's different from the others? But this game has its own mechanics, especially the Vigor. There is a LOT of vigors to use (which i never used 50%+ of it lol) which is number one reason that makes this game's gameplay unique. Additionally, there's also Tears which is unique to the game itself as well.

But the best thing about this is of course, the story. This is the one that"s keeps me playing this game for hours, and the ending doesn't disappoint me at all. (May contain spoiler) [spoiler] The ending may be confusing, like keep going back and forth in time (the beginning part where Booker is delivered to the lighthouse) and I literally have no idea what's going on. And suddenly a lot of Elizabeths come out of nowhere and just procede to drown Booker, like.. what? [/spoiler]. I had to look at the internet to fully understand it.

So TL;DR, Great game, or perhaps amazing. Confusing story line, but very interesting.

Bioshock Infinite is a game that I have restarted about four times for various reasons. First time was a hard drive failure (irrelevant really) but the second and third times I just stopped playing it because something better came along or I simply got bored. The fourth time however, I endured and experienced it without interruption and I'm happy to say it was definitely worth it.

The varied gameplay mechanics and the range of enemies you encounter are enough to keep things from becoming too repetive. As soon as it starts to toe that line you get a fantastic little story moment to keep you driven, pushing onward to see what happens next. Towards the end of the game the enemies do start to show signs of basically pallete swapping. They wear different outfits and their weapons hit harder, but they are essentially just more dudes to shoot at.

Overall though, it's an absolutely solid game and I am seriously considering investing in the DLC to keep things going.
My brain hurts. Infinite/10. Would do it again

I was dumbfounded at the end. Really worth all the money.

Would you kindly make more Bioshock games

If you like story based games and frequent interaction with an ally-sort-of-character, this is exactly the best game for you. There's no better one. Trust me.

The plot is covered in shadows all the time, which also makes it massively interesting. Together with the possibility of exploring through all the areas you are present in at the moment, hidden story based scripted interactions with your companion, which is, by the way, the most beautifully animated woman character with the most beautiful face, smile, even damn walk-style, voice and especially (!!) eyes, of all time, and all those weapons and vigors, very enjoyable and do believe me, that as soon as you start playing it, you will experience some horribly hard time trying to convince yourself to finally turn it off and go to bed.

Don't be afraid of story based video sequences, where you can just watch and not do anything, as there are just a few of them and they are quite short. I'm not a huge fan of these scenes in a game myself...'cause I'm here to play the game, right? But...after beating this game...wow, I wish there were more of them...and longer, much, much longer. You will love every single scene where you can just sit 'n relax and simply watch Booker interacting with Elizabeth. Even if you won't like the plot, I'm certain you will finish the game, because of her. It's almost impossible to just tell yourself.."well...screw this." She works as a perfectly functional and efficient glue. She won't let your ass to abandon your chair without at least 90 minutes spent ingame.

Conclusion? After beating this game, you will pray to god of gaming industry to make it longer. Like next 15 hours longer. As that's the time you'll spend with the basic campaing on hard difficulty, if you scan through every place you possibly can. Ofcourse there are things that could have been made better. But in the end, it is absolutely worth it. Even if it costs like 30â‚¬. You will be able to forgive the game everything, except some parts of the plot..as it's some quite emotional stuff. Simply, the game is so good it made the Call of Duty/PUBG based player realise that this is the greatest game he has ever played in his entire life.

So, if you haven't played this game yet...go on. Accept what's inevitable :D and play it finally, for f***s sake!


Pros:
+ story
+ enviroment (graphics are amazing yet not too demanding)
+ Elizabeth (possibly merge "story" point with this one, 'cause sooner or later you'll give no f***s 'bout the story; you'll care just about her)
+ weapons and means of tactical play
+ even if you are plying it for the second/third time..you will almost always find something new...and you will still enjoy the game

Cons:
- there possibly are some, but I ain't give a shit about them
- the campagn should have been like twice as long..I'd love it
- not enough Booker/Elizabeth interaction based video sequences uncontrollable by player

I had this game in my library for so long that I played it recently out of sheer guilt. I will not make the same mistake again.

Bioshock Infinite is a masterpiece and rightfully called as one of the greatest games of all time. The visuals, the art style and the gameplay are simply outstanding. I can't imagine how much research Irrational Games had to do to nail the period style that this game is set in. Masterful production.

The pacing is almost perfect except for the middle which I felt was a bit meandering. But the story and Elizabeth, the main protagonist and an amazing character, always keep you engaged. 

And speaking about the story...man!...it's incredibly intriguing all the way through but the finale just beggars belief. I did not see it coming and it left my jaw on the floor. A triumph in storytelling. I tip my hat to you, Ken Levine.

Just play the game. You do yourself a disservice if you don't.

Alright, so what you should know right off the bat about this game is that it doesn't take place in Rapture. You might have seen this already from the trailers though, but figured I'd get it out of the way. 

So, first off the bat, graphics. The visuals are simply stunning, the aestethic is bright and filled with light in most places. As you carry on though it will subtly go from brighter to darker avenues. If you feel it's too dark, don't be afraid to fix your gamma. The guide in the beginning of the game didn't really help me set the right tone since I fumbled around in a dark a lot towards the end of the game.

Story wise, oh yes, this is absolutely the best one out of all the series, but spoiler alert: The ending really doesn't make a lick of sense. But you won't really care anyway when you get there, because the game is going to keep you guessing anyway. So if you're the sort that likes analysis, you're going to love playing this game.

In terms of game mechanics, this game unfortunately suffers from consolitis. Which means that you only get to have two plasmids (called vigors here) active at one time and you can only carry two weapons. Highly annoying, but halfway through the game I didn't care, since I just picked up whatever weapon I had handy. It got really annoying in boss fights though since it's very possible to run out of ammunition halfway through the fight. And to add insult to injury, there's a boss that raises infinite minions. I seriously hate fake difficulty like that because it just means you have to kite all enemies and keep firing at the boss at all times. Tedium like that really put me off a game. However, thankfully that's just one boss so it's not big hurdle. 

On that note, the plasmids in this game are utterly boring, huge minus there. It's like the devs just forgot about all the other fun stuff in the game. Also, there's so much less hacking in this game, doors are now locked with actual locks which require you to use lockpicks which autosucceed. Again, I blame this on consolitis since that usually results in stupid "streamlining" like this. The same goes for the number and design of weapons, they definitely on the simpler side and not at all as fun as we've been spoiled with in the previous games. No special ammo either, boo developers, boo! Sometimes less isn't more, sometimes less is just simply less.

BUT.. here's where we get to the truly interesting part: Elizabeth. She's an NPC you play with the whole game. And the reason I waited so long to pick this game up. I hate escort missions with a fiery passion, hell if you could make it a plasmid it'd be quie useful. Anyway, I digress. Elizabeth is literally the perfect AI. She's invulnerable, she actually HELPS YOU during fights and after fights, she highligts interesting things in areas or recommend that you should check nearby area X for loot. 

Other devs, take note, THIS is how you make a good companion AI! Full marks for that one!

Also, there's a new mechanic where you jump around on big rails going through the sky and that's a really interesting mechanic which has a lot of advantages. Ever wanted to play Bionic Commando Rearmed as an FPS? Well now you can, sort of anyway. In fact, in the beginning of the game, I put on the BCR sound track and decided this was simply a prequel to that game and it kind of works too. 

Ultimately though, I have to say that the game was really short compared to the previous ones. I explored quite a bit in the game and found a lot of things, but there's a whole lot less content to play around with unfortunately. 

But to be honest, it's short but really sweet. Play it for the story alone I say.
